name: Nam June Paik
focus_summary: Foundational pioneer of immersive multi-monitor video environments.

key_works.title: Electronic Superhighway
key_works.notes: Room-scale neon and multi-channel video installation.

short_bio: Nam June Paik introduced immersive multi-channel video environments and helped define media art as a spatial experience. His work Electronic Superhighway surrounds viewers with electronic imagery and is a key precursor to contemporary immersive installations.

name: Iannis Xenakis
focus_summary: Composer-architect creating immersive sound and light architectures.

key_works.title: Polytope de Montréal
key_works.notes: Large-scale architectural sound and light environment.

short_bio: Iannis Xenakis created large-scale spatial audio and light environments that prefigured today’s immersive media. His Polytopes integrated architecture, computation and sound into early examples of fully enveloping audiovisual spaces.

name: Stan VanDerBeek
focus_summary: Expanded cinema pioneer who built the Movie-Drome multi-projection dome.

key_works.title: Movie-Drome
key_works.notes: Dome theater with multi-projector collage of moving images.

short_bio: Stan VanDerBeek pioneered expanded cinema with his Movie-Drome, a dome theatre that surrounded audiences with multiple simultaneous projections. His work anticipated the experiential logic of today’s fulldome theaters and immersive cinemas.

name: Jordan Belson
focus_summary: Visual music artist who created early immersive dome shows at Morrison Planetarium.

key_works.title: Vortex Concerts
key_works.notes: Series of electronic music and abstract projection concerts in a planetarium dome.

short_bio: Jordan Belson developed immersive audiovisual performances in planetariums long before digital domes existed. As visual director of the Vortex Concerts he combined abstract projections with electronic music, establishing planetariums as sites for immersive media art.

references.title: Cosmic Cinema: Jordan Belson and the Vortex Concerts
Jordan Belson – Center for Visual Music

name: Steina Vasulka
focus_summary: Video art pioneer exploring machine vision and electronic image processing.

key_works.title: Machine Vision
key_works.venue_or_context: Various galleries and media art venues
key_works.notes: Series of installations examining mediated perception through cameras and monitors.

short_bio: Steina Vasulka pioneered electronic image processing and machine vision in video art. Her installations explored how cameras and monitors transform perception, contributing essential techniques to later immersive and interactive video environments.

references.title: Steina Vasulka – Burchfield Penney Art Center Profile

notes: Often works collaboratively with Woody Vasulka, but listed here as an individual.

name: Woody Vasulka
focus_summary: Co-founder of early video art and electronic image experimentation.

key_works.title: The Kitchen – early video works
key_works.notes: Series of experimental video pieces and performances in one of the first media art spaces.

short_bio: Woody Vasulka was a key figure in early video art, co-founding The Kitchen in New York and developing new forms of electronic image processing. His experiments with video signal manipulation helped shape the vocabulary of immersive media installations.
notes: Often works collaboratively with Steina Vasulka; listed individually in this dataset.

name: Jeffrey Shaw
focus_summary: Pioneer of interactive and panoramic environments, including early CAVE-like works.

key_works.title: The Legible City
key_works.notes: Interactive virtual city navigated by riding a physical bicycle.

short_bio: Jeffrey Shaw is a leading figure in new media art who pioneered panoramic and interactive environments. Works like The Legible City and later CAVE-based projects defined key technical and conceptual approaches for immersive interactive media.

name: Maurice Benayoun
focus_summary: Media artist working with VR and CAVE-based immersive installations.

key_works.title: World Skin: A Photo Safari in the Land of War
key_works.notes: Interactive CAVE installation that won the Golden Nica for Interactive Art in 1998.

short_bio: Maurice Benayoun is a media artist whose work spans VR, interactive installations and public space interventions. World Skin, an interactive CAVE piece about war, became a landmark of immersive, politically charged virtual environments.

name: Rafael Lozano-Hemmer
focus_summary: Creates large-scale participatory light and sensor installations in public space.

key_works.title: Pulse Room
key_works.notes: Installation with hundreds of light bulbs driven by visitors’ heartbeats.

short_bio: Rafael Lozano-Hemmer creates large-scale interactive installations that transform public spaces with light, sensors and audience participation. Works like Pulse Room are key references for participatory immersive environments in institutional and urban contexts.

name: Toshiyuki Inoko
focus_summary: Founder and creative lead of teamLab, shaping large-scale interactive digital art environments.

key_works.title: teamLab Borderless
key_works.venue_or_context: MORI Building DIGITAL ART MUSEUM, Tokyo
key_works.notes: Museum-scale immersive environment of continuously flowing interactive digital artworks.

short_bio: Toshiyuki Inoko is the founder and key creative voice of teamLab, an art collective known for large-scale interactive digital environments. Under his creative direction, projects like teamLab Borderless and subsequent museums have become global benchmarks for immersive digital exhibitions.

references.title: Inside the Creative Cosmos: Toshiyuki Inoko’s Journey to Founding teamLab
TeamLab Co-Founder Toshiyuki Inoko – Artnet Interview

notes: Primary creative director figure associated with teamLab; the collective itself is not listed as a separate dataset entry.

name: Ersin Han Ersin
focus_summary: Artist and creative director of Marshmallow Laser Feast focusing on sensory immersive experiences about ecology and more-than-human perception.

key_works.title: We Live in an Ocean of Air
key_works.venue_or_context: Saatchi Gallery, London and other venues
key_works.notes: Multi-sensory VR installation using breath, heart-rate and environmental effects to connect visitors with a giant sequoia tree.

key_works.title: Breathing with the Forest
key_works.venue_or_context: Shifting Landscapes, Emergence Magazine exhibition, London
key_works.notes: Immersive installation exploring embodied connection with forest ecosystems.

short_bio: Ersin Han Ersin is an artist and creative director of the London-based experiential art collective Marshmallow Laser Feast. His work combines sculpture, installation, live performance and mixed reality to create immersive experiences that expand sensory perception and explore human–nature relationships.

references.title: Making the Invisible Visible – Conversation with Marshmallow Laser Feast
Ersin Han Ersin – TED Speaker Profile

notes: Key creative director figure at Marshmallow Laser Feast.

name: Barnaby (Barney) Steel
focus_summary: Co-founder and creative director of Marshmallow Laser Feast exploring expanded perception and more-than-human viewpoints.

key_works.title: In the Eyes of the Animal
key_works.venue_or_context: Forest tours, Sundance New Frontier and other festivals
key_works.notes: VR experience placing audiences in the perceptual worlds of forest creatures.

key_works.title: Evolver
key_works.venue_or_context: Cannes Film Festival Immersive Selection and other venues
key_works.notes: Immersive work directed by Barnaby Steel using volumetric capture to journey through the human body.

short_bio: Barnaby Steel is an artist and creative director of Marshmallow Laser Feast, an experiential art collective based in London. His practice focuses on immersive experiences that use technology to shift human perception and explore entanglement with the more-than-human world.

references.title: Exploring Nature with Marshmallow Laser Feast
Barney Steel – London Design Festival Speaker

notes: Co-founder and key creative director at Marshmallow Laser Feast.

name: Matt Clark
focus_summary: Founder and creative director of United Visual Artists, creating light and media environments for public spaces and performances.

key_works.title: Volume
key_works.notes: Interactive light and sound installation of illuminated columns responding to visitor movement.

short_bio: Matt Clark is the founder and creative director of United Visual Artists (UVA), a London-based art collective working with light, sound and space. His projects integrate sculpture, performance and site-specific installation, helping to define contemporary large-scale light-based immersive environments.
notes: Representative creative director of UVA for immersive installation and performance work.

name: Sakchin Bessette
focus_summary: Co-founder and Executive Creative Director of Moment Factory, leading hundreds of multimedia shows and installations worldwide.

key_works.title: AURA
key_works.notes: Immersive light and sound experience augmenting historic church architecture.

short_bio: Sakchin Bessette is co-founder and Executive Creative Director of Moment Factory, a Montréal-based studio recognised for multimedia shows, immersive attractions and experiential marketing. He has led the creative direction of hundreds of large-scale installations and live shows in public spaces, cultural institutions and branded environments.
notes: Key reference for large-scale live immersive shows and multimedia attractions.

name: Vince Kadlubek
focus_summary: Founder of Meow Wolf who helped pioneer large-scale walk-through immersive story worlds.

key_works.title: House of Eternal Return
key_works.notes: Flagship 20,000-square-foot immersive exhibition transforming a former bowling alley into an explorable narrative world.

short_bio: Vince Kadlubek is a founder of Meow Wolf, an art collective and entertainment company specialising in immersive, open-world walk-through experiences. Under his leadership, Meow Wolf developed House of Eternal Return and subsequent large-scale exhibitions that helped establish narrative immersive environments as a major cultural and commercial format.

references.title: This Artist-CEO Built a Collective That Tells Immersive Stories Through Art

notes: Representative founder figure for Meow Wolf’s immersive worlds.

name: Caity Kennedy
focus_summary: Co-founder and environment lead at Meow Wolf, shaping the visual language of explorable story worlds.

key_works.title: House of Eternal Return – Forest and House Environments
key_works.notes: Lead artist and project lead for multiple key rooms and forest environments within the exhibition.

short_bio: Caity Kennedy is a co-founder of Meow Wolf and a lead artist behind many of the collective’s landmark environments. Her work on House of Eternal Return and other exhibitions helped shape the dense, exploratory aesthetic that defines Meow Wolf’s immersive storytelling.
notes: Key art director and environment lead within Meow Wolf’s creative team.

name: Emily Montoya
focus_summary: Co-founder and Senior VP of Brand at Meow Wolf, directing the visual identity and characters across immersive worlds.

key_works.title: Meow Wolf Visual Identity & Mascot Snaggy
key_works.venue_or_context: Meow Wolf exhibitions and brand materials
key_works.notes: Creation of key characters and visual language that ties together Meow Wolf’s multi-site immersive universe.

short_bio: Emily Montoya is a co-founder of Meow Wolf and Senior Vice President of Brand. She shapes the visual identity of the company’s immersive worlds, creating characters such as the mascot Snaggy and defining the graphic language across exhibitions and media.
notes: Important for understanding immersive brand-building inside large-scale exhibitions.

name: Jin Lee
focus_summary: Vice President at d’strict and Creative Director of ARTE MUSEUM, leading large-scale immersive digital art exhibitions.

key_works.title: ARTE MUSEUM – ETERNAL NATURE
key_works.notes: Series of multi-sensory digital art exhibitions themed around eternal nature, using large-scale projections and LED surfaces.

short_bio: Jin Lee is Vice President at d’strict and the Creative Director of ARTE MUSEUM, a franchise of immersive digital art venues. She oversees the creative direction of exhibitions that blend art and technology to create multi-sensory environments themed around nature and cultural heritage.

references.title: d’strict: where art and nature meet technology
ARTE MUSEUM Dubai – Barco Press Release
ARTE MUSEUM Dubai Opened Its Doors

notes: Central creative director figure for the ARTE MUSEUM immersive franchise.

name: Eliza McNitt
focus_summary: VR director whose work Spheres helped define cinematic virtual reality at major film festivals.

key_works.title: Spheres
key_works.venue_or_context: Telluride, Sundance, Venice Film Festival (Venice VR)
key_works.notes: Three-part VR experience about the cosmos that secured a landmark seven-figure distribution deal out of Sundance.

short_bio: Eliza McNitt is a writer and director working in virtual reality whose project Spheres explores the universe through sound and embodied perspective. The work premiered at major festivals including Sundance and Venice and marked a turning point for the recognition of VR as a cinematic medium.
notes: Key example for immersive narrative direction in VR cinema.

name: Paul Mowbray
focus_summary: Director of NSC Creative, producing award-winning fulldome and XR shows for planetariums and themed attractions.

key_works.title: NSC Creative Fulldome Documentaries
key_works.notes: Series of internationally distributed immersive dome shows on astronomy and space exploration.

short_bio: Paul Mowbray is Director of NSC Creative, the immersive storytelling studio at the National Space Centre in the UK. With more than two decades of experience directing and producing fulldome and XR projects, he has worked on some of the world’s most widely shown immersive space documentaries for planetariums and science centres.

references.title: Paul Mowbray – ASDC National Conference Speaker Bio
references.publisher: The Association for Science and Discovery Centres

references.title: XR for New Audiences, NSC Creative

notes: Representative creative director for science-focused fulldome and XR storytelling.

name: Maciej Ligowski
focus_summary: Fulldome director and founder of Creative Planet, known for visually rich educational dome films.

key_works.title: Explore
key_works.notes: Award-winning fulldome show about space exploration and the journey to Mars.

short_bio: Maciej Ligowski is a fulldome director and the CEO and founder of Creative Planet. He has produced and directed internationally distributed planetarium shows such as Explore, which combine cinematic visuals with accessible explanations of astronomy and space exploration.
notes: Representative creative director for contemporary science-focused fulldome storytelling.

name: Carter Emmart
focus_summary: Director of Astrovisualization at the American Museum of Natural History, leading immersive space shows at the Hayden Planetarium.

key_works.title: Hayden Planetarium Space Shows (series)
key_works.venue_or_context: Hayden Planetarium, American Museum of Natural History, New York
key_works.notes: Series of immersive digital universe shows using the AMNH Digital Universe atlas.

short_bio: Carter Emmart is Director of Astrovisualization at the American Museum of Natural History, where he has led the development of immersive space shows in the Hayden Planetarium. Working with the Digital Universe atlas, he helped transform the planetarium from a star projector venue into a data-driven, cinematic flight through the cosmos.

references.title: Visualizing the Universe in the Hayden Planetarium

notes: Key reference for scientific fulldome visualization and live digital universe presentations.

name: Marc Tamschick
focus_summary: Founder and Creative Lead of Tamschick Media+Space, creating large-scale media scenography for museums and brands.

key_works.title: Invisible Worlds
key_works.venue_or_context: American Museum of Natural History, New York
key_works.notes: Immersive exhibition visualising micro- and nanoscale biological processes with large-scale media environments.

short_bio: Marc Tamschick is the founder and Creative Lead of Tamschick Media+Space, a Berlin-based studio specialising in immersive media scenography. He directs large-scale exhibition and brand experiences such as Invisible Worlds, which use projection, sound and interactive media to make complex scientific content emotionally accessible.

references.title: Scientific tools, immersive exhibitions and emotional connections – exploring Invisible Worlds with Marc Tamschick
The Process of Spatial Transformation – Marc Tamschick

notes: Representative of immersive scenography for scientific museums and corporate clients.

name: Uwe R. Brückner
focus_summary: Scenographer and founder of Atelier Brückner, shaping narrative exhibition design for museums and brand spaces.

key_works.title: BMW Museum Exhibition Design
key_works.notes: Immersive exhibition architecture and scenography combining vehicles, media and narrative spatial design.

short_bio: Uwe R. Brückner is a German architect and scenographer who co-founded Atelier Brückner and later Studio Uwe Brueckner. He is regarded as a leading figure in narrative exhibition design, applying his ‘form follows content’ philosophy to immersive museums and brand environments worldwide.

references.title: Uwe R. Brückner – iF Design Jury Profile
Competences and Experience | Studio Uwe Brueckner

notes: Important reference for immersive spatial storytelling in museums and corporate exhibitions.

name: Keiichi Matsuda
focus_summary: Director and designer known for the concept film Hyper-Reality, envisioning an over-mediated AR future.

key_works.title: Hyper-Reality
key_works.notes: Concept film depicting a city where physical and virtual realities have merged into a saturated AR interface.

short_bio: Keiichi Matsuda is a director and designer whose films explore the social and spatial implications of augmented and mixed reality. His project Hyper-Reality has become a key reference in discussions around immersive interfaces, layering critical design and worldbuilding onto a fully mediated urban environment.
notes: Influential for thinking about immersive interfaces in everyday life.

name: Nonny de la Peña
focus_summary: Founder of Emblematic Group, widely credited as a pioneer of immersive journalism in VR.

key_works.title: Hunger in Los Angeles
key_works.notes: Early VR documentary recreating a real incident at a Los Angeles food bank, often cited as a landmark of immersive journalism.

short_bio: Nonny de la Peña is a journalist and VR director known as a pioneer of immersive journalism. As founder and CEO of Emblematic Group she creates virtual reality pieces such as Hunger in Los Angeles, which combine real audio and 3D graphics to place viewers inside critical social events.

references.title: Hunger in Los Angeles – MIT Docubase

notes: Frequently described as the “godmother of VR” in the context of immersive journalism.

name: Rachel Rossin
focus_summary: New York-based artist merging painting, VR and installation to explore boundaries between physical and digital space.

key_works.title: N=7 / The Wake in Heat of Collapse
key_works.notes: Early VR installation using Oculus Rift to immerse viewers in a collapsing game-like environment derived from paintings and 3D scans.

short_bio: Rachel Rossin is a New York-based multimedia artist and self-taught programmer whose work blends painting, sculpture and virtual reality. Through exhibitions such as N=7 / The Wake in Heat of Collapse she explores the slippage between real and virtual space, making her a key figure in artist-led VR installations.
notes: Representative for artist-driven experiments with VR as an immersive artistic space.

name: Félix Lajeunesse
focus_summary: Co-founder and Chief Creative Officer of Felix & Paul Studios, directing cinematic VR and location-based space experiences.

key_works.title: Space Explorers: The ISS Experience
key_works.venue_or_context: International Space Station & location-based VR installations
key_works.notes: Multi-episode VR documentary series filmed aboard the ISS, later extended into the free-roaming experience The Infinite.

short_bio: Félix Lajeunesse is a Canadian filmmaker and co-founder of Felix & Paul Studios, an Emmy Award–winning immersive storytelling studio. As creative director he has co-directed numerous VR works, including Space Explorers: The ISS Experience and its large-scale extension The Infinite, which place audiences inside human stories of space exploration.
notes: Key example of cinematic VR direction and large-scale location-based space experiences.

name: Céline Tricart
focus_summary: Director and producer of emotionally driven VR narratives, including the award-winning experience The Key.

key_works.title: The Key
key_works.venue_or_context: Venice Film Festival – Venice VR, Tribeca and other festivals
key_works.notes: Interactive VR narrative about displacement and refugees, combining theatre and virtual reality.

short_bio: Céline Tricart is a director and stereographer whose work spans film, virtual reality and video games. Her VR experience The Key, which premiered at Venice and other major festivals, uses interactive storytelling to address themes of displacement and memory, establishing her as a leading voice in emotionally charged immersive cinema.
notes: Important reference for narrative VR addressing humanitarian topics.

name: Yuri (Yurii) Kostenko
focus_summary: Co-founder and CEO of Front Pictures, leading immersive projection systems and fulldome experiences worldwide.

key_works.title: Front Pictures Fulldome Systems & Shows
key_works.notes: Development of fulldome projection systems and shows, including award-winning installations and the UNIT.City chimney dome theater.

short_bio: Yuri Kostenko is co-founder and CEO of Front Pictures, a Ukrainian studio specialising in fulldome projection systems, immersive installations and stage visuals. Under his leadership the company has delivered dome theaters and media server solutions to planetariums and venues worldwide, helping to define the technical and creative infrastructure of contemporary fulldome and immersive shows.

references.title: Front Pictures and the FULLDOME Experience

notes: Representative for creative-technical direction of fulldome and immersive projection infrastructure.

name: Refik Anadol
focus_summary: Creates large-scale data- and AI-driven environments that transform architecture and LED canvases into continuously changing immersive spaces.

key_works.title: Unsupervised
key_works.venue_or_context: Museum of Modern Art, New York
key_works.notes: AI data sculpture trained on MoMA’s collection, visualising the museum archive and visitor data as an evolving immersive environment.

key_works.title: Quantum Memories
key_works.notes: Large LED installation based on quantum computation research, generating abstract, ever-changing landscape imagery.

key_works.title: WDCH Dreams
key_works.venue_or_context: Walt Disney Concert Hall, Los Angeles Philharmonic
key_works.notes: Projection-mapped data artwork using the orchestra’s sound archive to animate the concert hall façade.

short_bio: Refik Anadol is an Istanbul-born, Los Angeles–based artist and director whose data-driven and AI-based installations reimagine buildings, galleries, and LED screens as dynamic canvases. His immersive works sit at the intersection of architecture, machine learning, and audiovisual performance.

name: Carsten Höller
focus_summary: German installation artist known for large-scale slide and perception experiments that turn museums into participatory immersive environments.

key_works.title: Test Site
key_works.notes: Series of monumental slides commissioned for The Unilever Series, transforming the Turbine Hall into a multi-level immersive playground.

key_works.title: Upside Down Mushroom Room
key_works.venue_or_context: Fondazione Prada, Milan; later MOCA Los Angeles
key_works.notes: Iconic installation using inverted, overscale fly-agaric mushrooms to destabilise perception of space.

key_works.title: The Slide at ArcelorMittal Orbit
key_works.notes: Permanent slide sculpture coiling around the ArcelorMittal Orbit tower, offering a high-intensity bodily immersion in architecture and landscape.

short_bio: Carsten Höller is a German artist based in Stockholm whose large-scale slides, carousels and perceptual experiments turn exhibition spaces into participatory laboratories. Trained as an agricultural scientist, he applies experimental methods to explore how altered states, fear and joy shape human perception. Through projects such as Test Site at Tate Modern and numerous slide and mushroom installations, he has helped popularise experiential, bodily immersive art for broad audiences.

references.title: The Unilever Series: Carsten Höller: Test Site
references.notes: Exhibition page for Test Site, detailing Höller’s slide installation in the Turbine Hall.

references.title: Test Site
references.notes: Background on the Tate Modern slide installation and its context within The Unilever Series.

references.title: Carsten Höller – Biography
references.notes: Gallery biography outlining Höller’s practice, major exhibitions and focus on experimental environments.

name: Alejandro G. Iñárritu
focus_summary: Extends his feature-film practice into VR with mixed-reality installations that place visitors inside politically charged narrative environments.

key_works.title: CARNE y ARENA (Virtually present, Physically invisible)
key_works.venue_or_context: Fondazione Prada, LACMA and touring venues
key_works.notes: Award-winning VR installation immersing visitors in the experience of migrants crossing the US–Mexico border, combining physical staging with VR and sound.

short_bio: Alejandro G. Iñárritu is a Mexican filmmaker who has expanded into immersive media through the mixed-reality project CARNE y ARENA. The installation blends physical set design, spatial sound, and VR to create an embodied narrative about migration and borders, influencing how festivals and museums present story-driven VR.

references.title: Alejandro G. Iñárritu: CARNE y ARENA
CARNE y ARENA (Virtually present, Physically invisible)

name: Marco Brambilla
focus_summary: Known for dense video collages and large-scale screen environments that remix cinematic history into immersive panoramas.

key_works.title: King Size
key_works.notes: 16K resolution immersive video work commissioned for the Sphere, celebrating Elvis Presley and the mythology of Las Vegas as part of U2’s concert visuals.

key_works.title: Anthropocene
key_works.notes: Immersive video collage exploring mass media and environmental imagery in a continuous vertical scroll.

short_bio: Marco Brambilla is an artist and director whose video collages and monumental screen installations deconstruct pop culture and cinema. His commission for the Las Vegas Sphere and projects in museums and galleries position him as a key figure linking video art to contemporary large-scale immersive arenas.

references.title: Marco Brambilla Animates the MSG Sphere for U2 Las Vegas Residency
Marco Brambilla’s ‘King Size’ at the Sphere Las Vegas

name: Willie Williams
focus_summary: Long-time creative director and show designer for U2 and other major acts, integrating large-scale LED, immersive stages, and narrative concepts into live concerts.

key_works.title: U2:UV Achtung Baby Live at Sphere
key_works.notes: Creative direction and show design for U2’s inaugural Sphere residency, using the venue’s 16K wraparound screen and immersive sound to reframe the band’s catalogue.

key_works.title: U2 360° Tour
key_works.notes: Concert tour known for its 360-degree “claw” stage, early example of stadium-scale immersive scenic design.

short_bio: Willie Williams is a British show director and designer best known for decades of work with U2, where he helped pioneer concert tours as immersive, technologically driven spectacles. His role in the U2:UV residency at the Las Vegas Sphere extends this lineage into a new generation of venue-scale immersive media.

references.title: Even Better Than the Real Thing: U2 Opens Vegas Sphere

notes: Attribution focuses on Williams’ long-term U2 creative direction; specific Sphere role often described in trade press and production credits rather than formal academic sources.

name: Darren Aronofsky
focus_summary: Extends his auteur cinema into venue-specific immersive content and executive production of VR works.

key_works.title: Postcard from Earth
key_works.notes: First original immersive film produced for the Sphere, using its wraparound LED interior to create a cinematic travelogue of Earth.

key_works.title: Executive Producer of SPHERES
key_works.venue_or_context: Telluride, Sundance, Venice VR, and other festivals
key_works.notes: Executive-produced Eliza McNitt’s three-part VR series SPHERES, a landmark project in immersive space storytelling.

short_bio: Darren Aronofsky is an American filmmaker whose work in immersive media ranges from producing landmark VR projects to directing the Sphere-exclusive film Postcard from Earth. His projects help bridge mainstream cinema and emerging large-format immersive venues.

name: Martin Sambauer
focus_summary: Develops immersive fulldome films and event concepts that translate complex technologies and scientific topics into accessible, emotionally engaging experiences for corporate clients and public audiences.

key_works.title: KIRA
key_works.venue_or_context: International planetariums worldwide; Centennial of the Planetarium project
key_works.notes: Co-directed fulldome sci-fi film produced by Softmachine Immersive Productions for the centennial of the first planetarium, later adapted for Apple Vision Pro distribution.

key_works.title: Mars City Immersive
key_works.venue_or_context: Softmachine Immersive Productions, planetariums and special venues
key_works.notes: Co-directs the creative vision for a multi-format immersive project about future human settlements on Mars, combining scientific input with cinematic storytelling.

key_works.title: The Era of Immersive Events
key_works.venue_or_context: Softmachine Immersive Productions – Knowledge / Whitepaper context
key_works.notes: Strategic essay on how immersive events reshape corporate communication and innovation culture, positioning immersive media as a core tool for complex storytelling.

key_works.title: Immersive Show Budgeting
key_works.notes: Practical guide to budgeting immersive signature shows, based on decades of experience in corporate shows and fulldome productions.

short_bio: Martin Sambauer is a Munich-based creative director for immersive media and immersive events. After early work in broadcast and corporate communication, he now focuses on fulldome films, VR content, and strategic immersive event formats at Softmachine Immersive Productions. His work combines science communication, corporate storytelling, and consulting on how brands can use immersive media across global venue networks.
